intro: Daemonorops sepal, commonly known as the pandan plant, is a member of the palms family (Arecaceae). It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and large, feather-like leaves that are often used in cooking and traditional crafts. The plant produces small, clustered flowers followed by edible, fibrous fruits. Its roots and leaves contain essential oils and are valued for their aromatic properties. Daemonorops sepal thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in moist, shaded environments.
